          <typicalAgeRange>
            <string language="x-t-lre">16-17</string>
            <string language="en">16-17</string>
          </typicalAgeRange>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Objectives: 	to acquaint students with famous London sights 
	to revise expressions used for asking the way and 	giving direction 
	to develop listening skills

Stage I 
To warm up students the teacher asks: What images come to your mind when you think of London? Possible answers: Big Ben, double-decker. 

Stage II 
Students read a magazine article about London and answer multiple-choice questions. The teacher checks the answers and elicits the meaning of some words. 

Stage III
Students try to recall some phrases used for asking the way and giving directions .They use a map of London to carry out this activity. (pair work)

Stage IV
Before taking a virtual walk in London students are given several
questions so that they listen for specific information.
The pair who reaches the destination first and answers all the questions correctly is rewarded with a very good mark. (pair work)
At this point Calibrate learning resource is used.

Stage V
Homework:	Tell your friend what places in London are worth 	seeing. (oral task)
</string>
          </description>
        </educational>
